author: schone_wizard
content: can one of the calls address the 1,000 lb gorilla in the room called minority client risks/benefits to the solo staker?

author: schone_wizard
content: it would be really nice to hear from high up in the foundation more than just - majority pooling bad, minority is great, you take the risk, you're on your own, good luck.

author: schone_wizard
content: the biggest problem for the solo staker from the view point of one is that 1) it makes more sense even in the astronomically low chance of consensus failure, for the solo staker to keep choosing to stick with the finalizing "wrong" non canonical chain and 2) we can scream no bail out until we're blue in the face, the fact of the matter is that if 70% power holding entity (majority client) goes bombs up, some kind of a social recovery will need to take place or be considered at least 3) to date, there has been no conversation on what kind of risk one takes in terms of software quality from a minority client vs a majority one.  Yes all teams are great teams, with great products and the best of intentions but there's power in numbers and that's undeniable.

author: schone_wizard
content: For the reasons above, I think it would be nice to hear a formal conversation hashed out and what kind of (for lack of better word) guarantees could possibly be thought of to make it so that solo stakers have every reason to choose minority clients
